page.title: 10FARMING (continued)
page.content: in 1930. Before it was a pig farm it was a Ministry of Defence depot. There were supplies for soldiers. Mr. Davidson has one thousand, five hundred pigs. Altogether he has eight pens. Only seven pens are in use. He cooks about two thousand, five hundred gallons of swill a day. Each pig eats two gallons of swill a day. Oil is taken from the top of the pigs swill. It is collected and used for making lipstick and soap. At the sides of the farm are air raid shelters which were used in the Second World War. Mr. Chamberlain is the farmer of Hill Farm in Elmore. In his dairy there are new cow sheds. The cows come in through one door, and go to a bay. There is a spray that is used to spray on the cows teats. The spray is to stop the cow getting an infection. There were 5 bays and 4 nozzles to a
